page.title: 14CHANGING TIMES.2.
page.content: Part of Claire's family have lived in the area for over two hundred years.Fields and trees were replaced by prefabricated houses and then by new housing estates.There were only small cottages in High Street,Hill Lane and Railway Lane.There were far fewer schools for the area than there are now. Grandma remembers playing hopscotch,skipping and whip and top.Her home had two rooms upstairs and two rooms downstairs.Three children shared one bed.She thinks that modern houses are bigger and much cleaner. She has lived in the same council house for many years.At one time the rent was ten shillings (50p) a week.Now it is twenty-seven pounds.
